##Identity compromised? Big Data Management Trade-off behind epidemic prevention and control

I-CAIJING

CAIJING magazine official Wechat. "CAIJING" magazine, sponsored by the China Securities Market Research Center, was first published in 1998, adhering to the news concept of "independence, exclusiveness and originality" , and is known for authoritative, impartial and professional reporting, it is a must-read publication for policy-makers, researchers and managers in the field of politics and economics.

The following article is from the e law of Finance and Economics, by Liu Xiaochun

The e-law of Finance and economics is an original content brand derived from CAIJING magazine. We focus on rule of law, governance and ethics in the Internet industry.

The validity of the basis of dealing with personal information without consent based on the authority of dealing with epidemic information should not be questioned, but at the same time, more standardized mechanism and means should be set up to deal with personal information

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
By Liu Xiaochun

The use of "big data + Grid" means to deal with the epidemic in a comprehensive and sophisticated way, has now been adopted by the government as an important means to control the spread of the epidemic, which is also the implementation mechanism to improve the governance system and governance capacity. Recently, the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology (MIIT) quickly responded by deploying support work using big telecom data such as mobile phone signaling. From the media briefing held on February 14, can understand the current mobile operators to provide telecommunications big data analysis, support services to prevent and control the overall situation of the epidemic.

As can be seen from the questions in the press conference, one of the focuses of people's concern is the extent to which personal information obtained from mobile signaling analysis, such as whereabouts and geographic location, will be processed, disseminated and even disclosed. After all, everyone who uses a mobile phone may not be ready for it before the unexpected outbreak -- because the information that the phone provides to the carrier will be fully collected and recorded, as a basis for their own and public risk assessments, they may even face uninformed disclosure.

The legitimacy of the foundation should not be called into question

From the perspective of the prevention and control of Public Health Emergencies, the collection and processing of personal information is not only a necessary step of "big data + Grid" governance, but also the meaning of the whole emergency response. In a sense, the effectiveness of epidemic prevention and control depends heavily on the mechanism of surveillance, collection, reporting, interpretation and release of epidemic information, only on the basis of timely, accurate and comprehensive information acquisition and processing mechanism, can Support Scientific, effective, rapid decision-making, and implementation of a variety of specific initiatives. This includes taking different measures for different groups of people according to different risk levels, making efficient dispatch of materials and personnel, issuing appropriate information to the public and so on.

When it comes to public health and safety, appropriate derogations from individual rights and freedom of movement are not only clearly defined by laws and regulations, but are also policies that are easily accepted by the public, both intuitively and intellectually. In such a special case, the "information" attribute of personal information is also very clearly highlighted. As the basic supporting element of epidemic prevention and control, epidemic information inevitably includes the collection, processing and transmission of massive personal information, because human is the basic unit and carrier of epidemic spread.

In the field of personal information protection, the relationship between "public security" and "personal interest" , which is often discussed, is reflected as a magnifying glass under this special period. As a part of epidemic information and Prevention and control mechanism, it is inevitable for individuals to transfer their rights and interests, including personal information, in exchange for the control and safety of the overall risk.

Therefore, although the current system of personal information protection in China has not clearly established the "exception" rule of collecting and using personal information without the consent of the individual, whether based on the existing provisions of relevant laws and regulations, also based on general legal principles, the validity of the basis for dealing with personal information without consent should not be questioned by the authorities concerned on the basis of their authority to deal with epidemic information.

There are still some regrets about the standard handling

Unfortunately, in the early days of epidemic prevention and control, there did appear some personal information for unrestricted, unregulated random dissemination phenomenon. Government departments, the media and the public have all published or disseminated personal information that has not been "desensitized" , the identity of a large number of Wuhan citizens has been leaked, and the whereabouts of certain virus carriers have been widely reposted on social media, sparking public anger, and the netizen is similar to collective"human flesh is searched"and the phenomenon that Discloses Virus Carrier Undesirable Private Life Arouses Group ridicule, also be in few. In an epidemic, people's attention is highly focused and there is anxiety, which makes, the leakage of personal information will lead to certain groups of people in the "hot spot" , resulting in isolation, discrimination, or even serious damage to reputation and other consequences.

Unregulated processing and disclosure of personal information can lead to multiple adverse consequences. First, people at risk of contracting the virus tend to hide it and take it as a matter of course, because of concerns about privacy and criticism, which in fact can be a serious impediment to the smooth gathering of information about the outbreak, therefore, it has gone beyond the protection of personal interests to the level of threats to public security.

Secondly, the voluntary reporting mechanism is actually the most cost-effective information collection mechanism. If the irregular processing of personal information inhibits the initiative of risk groups to report voluntarily, then there is the need for a larger scale of monitoring and screening mechanisms, which, on the one hand, greatly increase the cost and the already limited resource consumption; on the other hand, the upgraded monitoring mechanisms bring privacy anxiety and insecurity to the more general population, in a vicious circle.

Last but not least, in the face of an epidemic, individual dignity also needs to be defended and respected. In the digital society, the need to protect personal information and privacy is increasingly recognized as an important interest of people's dignity and independent personality. The transfer of public health and safety benefits can be tolerated and can be collected and processed by the authorities without consent, but such transfers should be strictly limited to the purpose and scope of epidemic prevention and control. In particular, when the transfer of such rights is likely to involve further restrictions on other rights and freedoms of the population, greater care and regulation are needed.

Standardization Mechanism and means should be established

Specifically, the collection and processing of epidemic information may involve personal information, which can be very comprehensive three-dimensional. From a person's whereabouts, geographical location, home address, Work Unit, these closely related to the movement of location information, to contact networks, family members, identity information, such as "contact tracking" necessary to obtain information, as well as medical information, may be in a specific situation to be collected epidemic prevention and control.

From the perspective of epidemic prevention and control, on the one hand, it is necessary to monitor and grasp the situation of the movement of people in the whole country and key areas through the analysis of high-level big data, and to carry out situation assessment and forecast and early warning, assisting in the refinement and precision of the Policy Implementation Process; on the other hand, the identification and classification of groups of people identified as having different levels of substantial risk will require measures, as stated in the National Public Health Emergency Response Plan released in 2006, "preventive measures shall be taken against the floating population, control measures shall be implemented, measures shall be taken to isolate, observe and treat on-site patients and suspected patients of infectious diseases, and centralized or home medical observation shall be taken for close contacts according to the circumstances. ".

According to the government and the enterprises, in the information processing of the first group of people, the anonymous processing of personal information, that is, "data desensitization" , is only used for the overall situation analysis. The use of personal information of the second group involves the reduction, tracking and processing of the original personal information based on risk judgment.

More importantly, in addition to the processing of such personal information, there is a need to take appropriate measures against individuals based on the analysis of the information, which generally involve restrictions on individual rights such as freedom of conduct, coercive measures can also be taken in the event of a person's refusal to cooperate, with the possibility of criminal sanctions being used in serious cases. This has been stipulated in the regulations on emergency response to Public Health Emergencies promulgated by the State Council in 2003 and amended in 2011.

For example, "All returning personnel should stay at home or focus on observation for 14 days after arriving in Beijing, " said a circular on further clarifying the requirements for returning personnel during the epidemic prevention and control period issued by the Office of the COVID-19 on February 14. Those who refuse to accept home observation, centralized observation and other preventive and control measures shall be investigated for responsibility according to law. Before you return to Beijing, you must report in advance to your unit in Beijing and to the community (village) where you live, the amount of personal information involved and the amount of work involved are huge.

Suppose an individual returns to Beijing from a key area. According to the Beijing notice, he needs to report his itinerary to the unit and the community (village) and stay at home or observe intensively for 14 days. If, for various reasons, she could not be called a Florida, it is not uncommon to see such a situation in media reports, as a Florida could be called in by other people besides potential legal liability, or the active investigation of government departments or their authorized agencies (disease prevention and control agencies, hospitals, transportation departments, units / Communities, etc.) is informed, another possibility is to use mobile phone signaling and other mobile Internet tools to analyze the actual situation.

Of these three possibilities, the first two laws and regulations have already made clear provisions, for example, the law on the prevention and control of infectious diseases and the regulations on emergency response to public health emergencies, any unit or individual "shall have the right to report any potential emergency to the Government of the People's Republic of China and its relevant departments" , "When a patient with an infectious disease or a patient suspected of having an infectious disease is found, he or she shall promptly report the case to a nearby disease prevention and control institution or medical institution. " However, it is also the case that people are most easily concerned about the over-collection of personal information. How to effectively integrate this measure into the existing legal and regulatory system, as well as to put in place more targeted and appropriate policies and rules, needs to be urgently explored.

In the process of collecting, reporting, transmitting and feedback the personal information without the individual's consent, we need to establish the standardized mechanism and means. First of all, although any units and individuals have the right and even obligation to "report" , but the entrance to receive reports should be as centralized and standardized as possible, and timely public announcement. The personal information collected should be kept in a secure and confidential manner whenever possible, and the most basic training should be provided to the staff concerned, to avoid the mass distribution of personal information forms on the Internet by means of wechat groups and other means without restriction, and in fact there have been punishments for this, but the broader standardization mechanism, operational Processes and disciplinary frameworks, for example, are in urgent need of construction.

Secondly, the use of the principle of minimisation of personal information should also be applied to specific groups of people at risk when appropriate measures are determined, for example, try to limit the range of people who know the phone number, specific address and identity information, to avoid excessive interference to the relevant risk groups. Where wider dissemination of information is needed for early warning purposes, it should also be done as anonymously as possible, with only targeted or limited disclosure of the location, time and related concerns required for early warning purposes, it does not need to contain personally identifiable information, so as to avoid personal information leakage to the individual caused by the distress.

Local governments had previously posted online detailed descriptions of the movements of certain people over a period of days, including their villages, neighborhoods, house numbers, family names and interactions with relatives and friends, this is likely to lead to people in a particular community being able to locate specific individuals and create privacy concerns for them. A more appropriate approach would be for Beijing to make public announcements to the communities where confirmed or suspected cases have been found on a daily basis. Since this would completely "desensitize" individual identities, it is not in itself a disclosure of personal information, it can also better play an effective warning role for the public.

Using the method of "big data + Grid" to collect epidemic information and promote epidemic control can indeed improve the control effect in local areas by means of the technological advantages of big data, but this kind of technology has never been more deeply embedded in everyone's daily lives, and if it is not used sparingly, especially if it fails to maintain respect and reverence for privacy and personal information, it is likely to create a sense of insecurity and resistance among the public to "total surveillance" . In this way, on the one hand, it is not conducive to a more comprehensive and in-depth treatment of the epidemic; on the other hand, at the moment of the epidemic, it is only by designing, adopting and implementing humane norms and mechanisms that value the life and dignity of every individual, to truly strengthen the unity of the people, overcome the difficulties necessary to the sense of trust and cohesion, and usher in the final victory.

(the writer is Executive Director of the Center for Internet rule of law at the University of the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences, and Editor: Lu Wei)
